en.api_container_p_1: The data format can be reverse engineered on our GitHub. Please check the specification's version with the API version.
en.api_container_p_2: We have enabled CORS. Example with jQuery to get Facebook:
en.api_container_p_3: All JSON files are published under a Creative Commons license.
en.api_container_p_4: ToS Checker is an extension for Chrome/Chromium, by shybyte.
en.api_container_p_5: It would be great if you could give us feedback on this very simple API page on github or by email. Thanks!
en.api_container_ul_li: Each service (e.g. facebook) has a JSON file, see all at https://beta.tosdr.org/api/1/service/
en.api_jumbotron: We encourage people to develop applications and other services integrating our ratings into their work. This page should help you use our data for your own app. Our source code is on Github.
en.downloads_jumbotron_paragraph_1: Install the browser extensions to get instant information about the terms and privacy policies of websites you browse!
en.error_page_not_found_description: This page does not exist on ToS;DR, are you sure you entered it correctly?
en.error_service_not_found_description:
No matching service has been found. You can add a service on our forum.
https://forum.tosdr.org/request
en.frontpage_intro_bottom_text: Terms of service are often too long to read, but it's important to understand what's in them. Your rights online depend on them. We hope that our ratings can help you get informed about your rights. Do not hesitate to click on a service below, to have more details! You can also get the ratings directly in your browser by installing our web browser add-on:
en.frontpage_intro_top_text: We are a user rights initiative to rate and label website terms & privacy policies, from very good Class A to very bad Class E.
en.frontpage_jumbotron_text: “I have read and agree to the Terms” is the biggest lie on the web. We aim to fix that.
en.help_expanding: Help expanding this list by contributing on Phoenix!
en.plugin_core_about_jumbotron_paragraph_1: “Terms of Service; Didn't Read” (short: ToS;DR) is a young project started in June 2012 to help fix the “biggest lie on the web”: almost no one really reads the terms of service we agree to all the time.
en.plugin_core_about_jumbotron_paragraph_2: Background. The rough idea behind ToS;DR emerged during the 2011 Chaos Communication Camp near Berlin, with people from Unhosted a movement to create web apps that give users control over their valuable user data and privacy. In the summer of 2012, Hugo Roy (@hugoroyd) started the legal analysis and brought the project to life. Since then, more people have joined the team and have contributed through the reviewer community. Ultimately, all the work is transparent and the discussions happen in public. Our work is funded by non-profits organisations and individual donations and gets released as free software and open data.
en.plugin_core_about_jumbotron_paragraph_3: Please bear in mind that the project is still in the early phase and that most data is subject to important changes. More information about our classification.
en.plugin_core_about_jumbotron_paragraph_4: What does “ToS;DR” mean? the name is inspired by internet acronym TL;DR which stands for "Too Long; Didn't Read" and is often used on blogs and emails when a block of text is just really long and that people are too lazy to read the whole stuff. It was intended more as a code name than as a real name. But it seems that people like it (do you?)
en.plugin_core_chrome_description: This extension will add a small icon in the right side of your address bar. If you are browsing a website that is not in our database, nothing will appear. Click on the icon to get the summary of the terms, provided by ToS;DR. When you land on a website with very bad terms, a small notification will pop up in the bottom right hand corner to warn you.
en.plugin_core_edge_description: This extension will add a small icon just next to the address bar, on the left. If you are browsing a website that is not in our database, nothing will appear. Click on the icon to get the summary of the terms, provided by ToS;DR.
en.plugin_core_firefox_description: This add-on will add a small icon in the right side of your address bar. If you are browsing a website that is not in our database, nothing will appear. Click on the icon to get the summary of the terms, provided by ToS;DR.
en.plugin_core_opera_description: This extension will add a small icon on the top right-hand corner. If you are browsing a website that is not in our database, nothing will appear. Click on the icon to get the summary of the terms, provided by ToS;DR.
en.plugin_core_safari_description: This extension will add a small icon just next to the address bar, on the left. If you are browsing a website that is not in our database, nothing will appear. Click on the icon to get the summary of the terms, provided by ToS;DR.
en.redirect_notice: Hello! You might have wondered how you got here. We are currently testing our new site with 5% of the visitors, which apparently included you! If you would like to give us Feedback, head over to our GitHub and create an issue there!
